organic_results.title: Comment: Shooting the Rapids of 21st-Century Intellectual Turmoil
organic_results.snippet: Paul W. Kingston, and Carolyn Riehl in this issue exemplify important currents in the state of the field and illustrate its dilemmas as it enters the new century. Although Bidwell and Kingston address different substantive and theoretical questions and follow different strategies to build their arguments, their articles stand within dominant traditions in the sociology of education in the last half of the 20th century. Both are relatively focused investigations of one theoretical issue, though both move outward from that issue in some …
